title: How to Reactivate a Deleted Twitter Account

steps.title: Go to the X login page.
steps.content: Go to the X login page. Open a new tab on your web browser and go to the X/Twitter website . Two text boxes will appear on the center of the login page. One is for entering your X username and the other is for inputting the password.

steps.title: Enter your account username in the first box.
steps.content: Enter your account username in the first box. The account username is your X handle, the one that begins with @. You can also use the email address or phone number you registered with X.

steps.title: Type in the password of the X account.
steps.content: Type in the password of the X account. Do this in the second text box. Make sure that it is the password for the X account that you want to recover, and that it is correct.

steps.title: Click the blue “Log in” button below the text boxes.
steps.content: Click the blue “Log in” button below the text boxes. As soon as you are logged in, your account is reactivated. Your home page is automatically displayed when you successfully log into your X account.

steps.title: Open the email account you linked with the X account.
steps.content: Open the email account you linked with the X account. For instance, if you registered your Gmail address with the X account you want to reactivate, go to Gmail and log in.

steps.title: Compose a new mail.
steps.content: Compose a new mail. Click the Compose button of your email provider, and in the subject line, enter “Restore my deactivated Twitter account.” In the To field, type in this email address: restore@twitter.com In the body of the mail, indicate why you need to restore your account. For instance, you can say the deactivation was temporary. Also, remember to indicate your X username.

steps.title: Send the email and wait for X to reactivate your account.
steps.content: Send the email and wait for X to reactivate your account. Once you send the email, X will add you to the list of those people waiting for their accounts to be restored. It will take around 4 weeks for your account to be restored. You will then receive an email notification from X informing you that your account is fully activated. You can now access the account by logging into it at the X website.
